name: NO PEOPLE TO SEE. KNOW PEOPLE TO SEE.
description: During the lockdown of the pandemic, one sentence kept coming back over and over for some reason to me and on this day I decided to listen to it and think it through. The sentence was: NO PEOPLE TO SEE. I kept saying it over and over again, as if to explore the phonetical and audio qualities of the sentence. What wound up happening was discovering a complete homophone version of the entire sentence. From the original sentence, I began to think about the homophone of NO, which is KNOW. Let's switch the words now and see what we get: KNOW PEOPLE TO SEE. You can see now that both sentences sound exactly the same, but when you read the first sentence, it comes off as a general declarative sentence that there are no people in the area or just in general to physically see. Now the second sentence has a different connotation altogether. It has more of a prophetic tone to it; an almost mystical declaration that to truly see and perceive truth, you need to know people and understand relationships.
